articles.title: Marissa Shephard pleads guilty to manslaughter, arson

articles.description: Twelve separate lawsuits have been filed against Moncton-based cannabis producer Organigram following a legionnaires' disease outbreak in 2019.

articles.author: Kate Letterick
articles.title: Speeding cyclists warned to slow down on Moncton trail
articles.description: The city of Moncton is hoping to slow speeding cyclists along the Riverfront Trail with a new sign. The "school zone" style sign flashes how fast a cyclist is going, if they exceed the 15 km/h speed limit.
articles.content:
The city of Moncton has a new tool to remind some cyclists on the Riverfront Trail to slow down.
A school zone style traffic sign has been installed on the trail, behind La Bikery.
It will light up… [+2634 chars]

articles.title: 22-year-old woman suffers life-threatening injuries in Moncton hit and run
articles.description: A 22-year-old woman was taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries after being struck Wednesday in Moncton by a car whose driver then left the scene.

articles.title: Moncton affordable housing group buys properties, aims to house people by September
articles.description: Rising Tide Community Initiatives, a Moncton affordable housing non-profit, has purchased its first properties and aims to start moving people into those buildings by Labour Day.
